title: How does Zinc benefit the skin? - Quora

response.answer_text: ZINC is one of the essential nutrient for healthy skin and hair. It is also important for body immunity, Hormonal Function, mental health( issues highly related to skin conditions) First let us see, What are the signs of Zinc Deficiency on our Body?? AcneWhite Spots on nailsStretch marksWhite coated tongueSlow healing of wounds and cutsHair loss as well as frizzy hairRecurring InfectionsIf you are experiencing three or more of these signs and symptoms you may have a zinc deficiency. Zinc gets depleted quickly depleted when we are sick, and also if we have a chronic skin condition. Our body uses zinc in the wound healing process, so for example if we have acne and our skin is forever in repair mode, it gets to the point where your zinc stores are just depleted and this is when scarring begins to happen and those pimples stays on. How Zinc Benefits the Skin: 1. Kills acne-causing bacteria( Cutibacterium acnes or Propionibacterium acnes) that invade pores and cause acne. 2. Fights inflammation together with other important anti-inflammatory, antioxidants such as vitamins A, C, E, and selenium 3. Zinc and vitamin A function as companion nutrients in the body and play a critical role in cellular growth, repair, and healing of the skin and all tissues. 4.Zinc also reduces the activation of keratinocytes – which are cells that produce keratin (a protein that binds the cells together). Excess keratin can lead to blocked pores and acne. These properties of Zinc help with healing scars and also preventing herpes outbreaks. Source: Zinc For Acne – Does It Really Help Zinc-Rich Food Sources:  You can also see this for more Zinc Sources and its intake in (mg/day): https://www.dietitians.ca/Downloads/Factsheets/Food-Sources-of-Zinc.aspx Hope it helps :)
